message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about different types of energy transfer. Option (C) is the correct answer because an electronic torch, also known as a flashlight, is powered by batteries and does not require being plugged into an electrical outlet. Option (A) and (B) are incorrect because both an electric grill and an electric stove require being plugged into an electrical outlet to transfer energy. Option (D) is incorrect because a microwave oven also requires being plugged into an electrical outlet to transfer energy.

This question requires knowledge about different ways energy can be transferred to an object without being plugged in. Option (C) is the correct answer because an electronic torch (flashlight) can use batteries to generate and transfer energy to illuminate the light. Options (A), (B), and (D) all require being plugged into an electrical power source in order to transfer energy.

This question is testing knowledge of non-plug-in methods of transferring energy. Option (C) is correct because an electronic torch, or flashlight, can transfer energy to its bulb using batteries, which do not require being plugged in. Options (A), (B), and (D) all require being plugged into an electrical source for the transfer of energy. Therefore, they are incorrect.

This question tests knowledge about the concept of wireless or non-contact energy transfer. Option (C), an electronic torch, is correct because it can be powered by batteries or rechargeable cells, which do not require being plugged in to a power source. Options (A) and (B), an electric grill and an electric stove, respectively, require being plugged into an electrical outlet to function. Option (D), a microwave oven, also requires being plugged into an electrical outlet to transfer energy and generate microwaves for cooking.

This question tests knowledge about different forms of energy transfer. Option (C) is the correct answer because an electronic torch, also known as a flashlight, uses batteries to generate light energy without needing to be plugged in. Options (A) and (B) refer to appliances that require being plugged into an electrical outlet to function. Option (D) refers to a microwave oven which uses electricity to generate heat energy and requires being plugged in to operate.

This question requires knowledge about different types of energy transfer. Option (C) is correct because an electronic torch, also known as a flashlight, can be powered by batteries or rechargeable cells without needing to be plugged in. Options (A) and (B) are incorrect because both an electric grill and an electric stove require a power source (plugged in or otherwise) to generate heat and function. Option (D) is incorrect because a microwave oven also requires a power source to generate microwaves and heat food.

This question tests knowledge about the different ways that energy can be transferred. Option (C) is the correct answer because an electronic torch, or flashlight, typically operates on battery power and does not need to be plugged into an electrical outlet to function. Option (A) is incorrect because an electric grill requires electricity from an outlet to operate. Option (B) is incorrect because an electric stove also requires electricity from an outlet. Option (D) is incorrect because a microwave oven also requires electricity from an outlet to function.

This question is testing knowledge of different methods of energy transfer. Option (C) is correct because an electronic torch, also known as a flashlight, can transfer energy to the lightbulb without being plugged in. It uses batteries or rechargeable cells to store and provide electrical energy to power the light. Option (A), an electric grill, and Option (B), an electric stove, both require a direct electrical connection to a power source, so they do not transfer energy without being plugged in. Option (D), a microwave oven, also requires an electrical connection to power the microwave generator that produces microwaves for cooking food.

This question is asking about how energy can be transferred to an object without the need for being plugged in. In this case, option (C) is the correct answer because an electronic torch, or flashlight, can be powered by batteries. The energy required to light up the flashlight is stored in the batteries and transferred to the light source when the flashlight is turned on. Options (A), (B), and (D) all require being plugged into a power source in order to transfer energy and therefore are not correct answers.
